summary: The Ecosystem Architecture series examines the transformation of the concept of 'ecosystem' from its biological beginnings to its broader application in modern human organizations. Underpinned by the growth of the internet, this evolution encourages decentralized, non-hierarchical structures. The series discusses the necessity of adopting 'Ecosystem Architecture' models to build flourishing, decentralized communities that transcend traditional spatial and temporal limitations.
excerpt: Covers the evolution of 'ecosystem' from biology to human organizations, promoting 'Ecosystem Architecture' for decentralized, thriving communities.
